page.description: A variable in the Alpha Anywhere namespace can hold one of the following types of data:

case.title: Any
case.description: The variable can contain any type of data.

case.title: Date
case.description: A date, where the date is between 00/00/0000 and 12/31/9999. The length is always 8 characters.

case.title: Function Pointer
case.description: Contains a pointer to a function name.

case.title: Numeric
case.description: A number of up to 19 digits. There is no concept of a NULL value for a numeric variable or field, which by default has an initial value of 0.

case.title: Object reference
case.description: A reference (pointer) to an object, or a pointer to a "dot" variable.

case.title: Time
case.description: A date/time value that stores the date, hour, minute, seconds and hundredths of a second. The length is always 17 characters.

case.title: Collection
case.description: An ordered list containing any type of data.

case.title: Short Time
case.description: A time value that stores the hour, minute, seconds and hundredths of a second. The length is always 9 characters.

section.description: Once a variable's data type is determined, it cannot be changed. However, you can use the DELETE command to delete a variable and then use the DIM command to redefine it as a different type.
section.note: As a best practice, you should not name variables with the names of data types. For example, do not name a field that contains a date value "Date". However, Xbasic is lenient will not enforce this practice.
There are several table field types, such as exponent numeric ("E"), image reference ("I"), JPEG image ("J"), memo ("M"), OLE ("O"), and rich text memo ("R") that are not data types.
